Description: Wooden figure of Ramses IX, standing with left foot advanced, wearing nemes head-cloth and kilt, the eyes and eyebrows are modelled in the round rather than having been inlaid, the arms are missing although both tenons survive, the figure probably held a mace in the right and a stave in the left hand, the legs have been restored, the whole bears traces of a layer of bitumen.
Curator's comments: Often said to be from the tomb of Ramesses II. Published: PM I Part 2: p.507 Published: T. Phillips [ed.], Africa, London 1995, pp. 88-89 [1.51] = T. Phillips [ed.], Afrika, Berlin 1996, pp. 88-89 [1.51]. Published: N. Penny, The Materials of Sculpture, 1993, pp. 124-126, 280
